events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle on highway, causing visible damage to the front bumper and left headlight.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and keywords such as vehicle and collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and initiate follow-up actions with the customer.
The customer was promptly notified that their auto accident claim has been received and is being processed.
Requested police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates to support the investigation of the accident claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and detailed images showing the extent of the vehicle damage.
Investigation into the auto accident claim commenced with review of submitted documentation and coordination with repair shops.
Completed investigation confirming the damage was consistent with the reported collision and verifying repair costs.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on the assessed damage repair estimate and coverage limits.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the handling of their claim.
The claim was officially approved for payment following confirmation of agreement on the settlement terms.
Payment for the auto accident claim was issued to the customer, covering the repair expenses as agreed.
The auto accident claim was closed successfully after payment issuance and confirmation that all matters were resolved.
The case files and all documentation related to the auto accident claim have been archived for record-keeping purposes.
